JOINT SUPP17
2.
Mandalam G.Errampalem Grama Dor.5-135 Kapurasthura Mekala Ratnam Garu's wife 3. Lovadurga (34 years old) (Aadhar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) jointly wrote and gave a settlement deed for the immovable property.
The 1st of you is the wife of the 1st of us, the mother of the 2nd and 3rd of us, the 2nd of you is the only son of the 1st of us, and the brother of the 3rd of us.
The 2nd of you and the 2nd of us are the same. Due to our love and affection for you, we have decided to give you some immovable property, namely, the property of our maternal grandfather, the 1st of us, along with his father's brother, In the joint family property division before 1984, we have sold the remaining land to others and have built a palm leaf house on the land that was allotted to the 1st of us in the name of the 1st of us in the records of the Gram Panchayat and have been enjoying the possession and full rights of the property till date, and we have paid the Gram Panchayat taxes in the name of the 1st of us, and we have given you the property listed in the Schedule below free of charge and have arranged the Schedule property in accordance with the conditions mentioned below and have written this settlement deed in your name. Therefore, from now on, all the village tax payable on the Schedule property Panchayat Board
Taxes shall be paid by Padipe Chanti, the 1st resident, for the duration of his life, without any mortgages, sales, etc. to others, i.e., without any power of donation and sale, and shall reside in the Scheduled Property for the duration of his life, and after the life of the 1st resident, Padipe Ramana, the 1st resident, shall take possession of the said property and from that time on, she shall pay all the Gram Panchayat Board taxes due to her for the Scheduled Property, without any mortgages, sales, etc. to others, i.e., without any power of donation and sale, and shall reside in the Scheduled Property for the duration of his life No/Year: 10618/2024

JOINT SUBTAKTHAR3.
In order to reside in the property during her lifetime, after the life of the 1st occupant of us and the 1st occupant of you, the 2nd occupant of you, Padipe Srinu, shall take possession of the Scheduled Property and pay all the Gram Panchayat Board taxes payable on the Scheduled Property at that time, and shall enjoy it freely and happily for a period of one month, with all the rights of donation and sale at his will, and his sons and grandsons shall enjoy it freely and happily for a period of one month.
In this regard, all the obstacles, whether they have arisen from anyone or from whom, shall be removed at our own expense and the Scheduled Property shall be freely and freely exercised by us or by you.
Whether the Scheduled Property has been mortgaged or sold to anyone else in the past We hereby declare that the property is free from any encumbrances, court seizures, liens, tax arrears, etc. and that we have full right to the property and that there are no other right holders except us. We hereby give you this settlement deed in your name. The Scheduled Property is hereby registered in the name of the 2nd of you in the Gram Panchayat records. The Scheduled Property is not a property assigned by the Government under A.P. Act No. 9/77. Schedule:- Bikkavolu Sub-D. Bikkavolu Mandal Bikkavolu Gram Panchayat Area Bikkavolu Taluk 18-68, Harijanpet, Dorun No. 18-68, the said house and the said land are bounded by the Koltalu boundary. (S.No. 420/2)

boundaries.boundaryE: House compound wall of Bura Krishna Rao

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 10618 of 2024, dated 03/Dec/2024, executed by 1. Padipe Chanti, 2. Padipe Srinu, 3. Mekala Lova Durga, in favour of Padipe Ramana & Padipe Srinu (Where as 1st Donee is the Wife 1st Donor & Mother of 2nd, 3rd Donors & 2nd Donee is the Son of 1st Donor and Brother of 3rd Donor and 2nd Donor is representing Himself As a 2nd Donee), towards the property admeasuring an extent of 133 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 18-68, comprised in survey number 420/2, Block No. 18, situated in Harijanapeta, Biccavolu Village & Gram Panchayat, Biccavolu Mandal, within the District of East Godavari, registered at sub-registrar office Biccavolu, is bounded as follows: North by: House Wall of Avala Ramana, 42 Sq. Ft South by: House Site of Karri Apparao, 42 Sq. Ft East by: House compound wall of Bura Krishna Rao, 28.6 Sq. Ft West by: Rajaveedhi, 28.6 Sq. Ft
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: 1.It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible. 2.It should be noted that the deed is executed by 2nd Donor representing himself as the Donee, thereby acting in a dual capacity, which constitutes a conflict of interest and is legally invalid. Therefore, it is advisable for the F.I. to verify the same and proceed as per its internal policy.
